characters.name: Brenda
traits: Becomes more vigilant and cynical over time
characters.backstory: The sole member of the HR department, she is buried under a fortress of paperwork. Her job is less about human resources and more about damage control and navigating the factory's rampant chaos.
quirks: Considers adding a 'How to Call 911' section to orientation
Maintains a crime scene kit in her office due to Calamity Carl
Was blackmailed with evidence of submitting her cat's vet bills as workplace injury claims
conflicts: The entire workforce's incompetence and corruption
key_actions: Oversaw the 'Bottom of the Barrel' hiring spree
Dealt with the 'Incident Report Inferno' caused by Carl
Investigated the missing inventory, ultimately exposing Frankie
Was blackmailed into the 'Midnight Sausage' heist as the cover-up person
Fired Frankie and other scapegoats after the fallout
dialogue_examples: Are you seriously suggesting a pallet of sausages developed legs and wandered out of the warehouse?
Answers I don't have yet. Or maybe I have too many and they're all terrible.
Carl, come in here for a sec. Don't touch anything.

characters.name: Frankie Falzone
characters.backstory: Deeply in debt to a mob-connected loan shark ('Big Tony') due to gambling (poker, ferret racing). Uses his position to steal inventory to pay off his debts.
quirks: Carries a dented silver flask of cheap whiskey
Comes up with outlandish alibis (e.g., invisible widgets, sentient forklifts)
Wears ankle weights, claiming it's for 'performance enhancement'
alliances: His reluctant heist crew (Carl, Maria 'The Moth', Barry)
conflicts: The Blood Sausage Boys and Pallet Pirates
key_actions: Systematically stole inventory for months
Orchestrated the 'Midnight Sausage' heist to pay off mob debts
Blackmailed several employees into helping him
Was exposed by Brenda and subsequently fired
dialogue_examples: Whatchu talkin’ ‘bout, Brenda? Everything’s copacetic here.
This whole damn factory… it'll chew you up and spit you out! You gotta… adapt! Innovate!
It's a working title! Got any better ideas, tough guy?

characters.name: Carl Peterson
traits: Not malicious, just a walking hazard
characters.backstory: A human embodiment of entropy who exists on a different plane of reality where the laws of physics are mere suggestions. He is a constant source of incident reports.
quirks: Managed to drive a forklift into a stack of pallets
Tripped over air, walked into stationary objects
Once microwaved a burrito for so long it set off the fire alarm
Believes in 'sausage diamonds'
alliances: Reluctant member of Frankie's heist crew
key_actions: Caused the 'Incident Report Inferno'
Was the central figure in the 'OSHA's Worst Nightmare' inspection
Acted as the main diversion ('Symphony of Screw-ups') during the 'Midnight Sausage' heist
Was fired as a scapegoat after the investigation
dialogue_examples: Hey Brenda! What's up? Did I break something again?
Sausage diamonds…
Chin up, Frankie! Maybe tomorrow we can get a pizza for lunch? My treat!

characters.name: Tony Moretti
characters.backstory: A figure with deep connections to both organized labor and organized crime. He acts as the 'muscle' for the unionization efforts while also running a loan sharking operation that has ensnared Foreman Frankie.
quirks: Has 'boys' or 'associates' (like Vinny) who do his dirty work
Emanates an aura of quiet menace
Gives cryptic smiles and uses veiled threats
key_actions: Visited the factory to 'encourage' unionization
Threatened Frankie to pay back his debts
Led negotiations for the union against management
Was scapegoated by the company for 'disruptive influences'
dialogue_examples: We're here about the… situation. The… unhappiness.
We're done here. The strike continues.
You got a problem, you come talk to Tony. Understand?

characters.name: Maria Rodriguez
characters.backstory: A natural leader who took night classes and became the de facto voice and strategist for the union, fighting for better wages and working conditions. Develops a romance with Benny during the strike.
quirks: Always carries a copy of the union contract in her back pocket
Has a surprisingly calming force amidst chaos
Makes legendary empanadas
key_actions: Became a key figure in organizing the union
Acted as a lead negotiator during the strike
Sabotaged production by mislabeling boxes
Formed a relationship with Benny on the picket line
dialogue_examples: Welcome to the fight, kid. You got rights. Don't let 'em forget it.
They think they can wear us down. But we're stronger than they think. We have to be.
Maybe if we actually trusted each other, you wouldn't have to worry about your wrench going missing.

characters.name: Dolores
characters.backstory: The undisputed leader of the breakroom. She knows everyone's secrets and isn't afraid to use them. She also dabbles in herbal remedies, with catastrophic results.
quirks: Permanently surrounded by a cloud of cigarette smoke
Dispenses cynical advice and dubious 'detox' cleanses
Herbal remedies tend to have explosive side-effects
conflicts: Anyone who challenges her authority in the breakroom
key_actions: Runs the breakroom with an iron fist
Acts as a key distributor in the breakroom black market
Gave Marco the 'Caffeine Cleanse' that resulted in a biohazard situation
dialogue_examples: Kid, lemme give you some advice. The coffee here tastes like burnt socks, but it's better than working sober.
Now, Marco, don’t you worry your little head. There are natural ways to cleanse the system.

characters.name: Barry Higgins
characters.backstory: A perpetually uncomfortable HR employee who desperately wants to be part of the 'Smoko Clique' but is mostly ignored or tolerated. He was caught embezzling from the company softball fund.
quirks: Puffs on a vape pen, much to the disgust of the real smokers
Reheats fish in the office microwave
Regrets every life choice that led him to his current situation
alliances: Reluctant member of Frankie's heist crew
key_actions: Attempted to join the Smoko Clique
Was blackmailed by Frankie into scheduling a mandatory meeting as a diversion for the heist
Resigned due to 'stress-related toenail fungus' after the fallout
dialogue_examples: Frankie, perhaps we could discuss this later, in a more…private setting?
We have…employee assistance programs. Confidentiality is assured.

characters.name: Gus
traits: Skilled at maintenance (but not at expressing feelings)
characters.backstory: A competent maintenance tech who has developed a powerful crush on Brenda from HR. He expresses his affection through 'helpful' acts of maintenance that invariably backfire.
quirks: His love language is preventative maintenance
Smells vaguely of WD-40
Accidentally 'upgraded' Brenda's office equipment into unusable, high-powered machinery
key_actions: Attempted to woo Brenda by 'fixing' her chair, fan, and stapler with disastrous results
dialogue_examples: (Mumbling about) preventative maintenance.
